This is re review This could be the best habit tracker goal setter and task manager with some really great features like nested li and smart auto grouping and very versatile repeat task setup Just don confuse the game in RPG for any actual gameplay but it does have very elaborate character design and advancement tem that deserves recognition allowing for well rounded and unique hero which grows with every task performed in the user daily life However Do It Now does hamstring itself by overlooking some very important integral functionality Firstly there is no way to order the ta set out in any of the groups After solid month of use building some projects with subta which had subta and setting up several habit based routines the lack of prioritisation or task ordering created confusing clutter of items which looked no different from the next While auto grouping and smart grouping should have been able to help sort that out the lack of ability for the user to remove any task from these groups meant every task appeared once again losing the important ones in the clutter User defined groups could only contain the items specifically placed in them but once again large project with number of different aspects can not be ordered into sensible linear series With no social aspect currently attached to the app as at ver there is no task sharing There is also no designated pc mac linux front end for desktop syncing Finally it expensive as apps go one off of will get the full version or about month paid yearly which removes ads and gives calendar access Original review good way to make the tedium of self regulation bit more fun Being able to plan to skip things when away from regular activities is handy It would be nice to see characteristic and skill based modifiers affect related task improvements as they raise and subtask attached leader

The one major short coming of this app and most other habit trackers is that it does not have any option to calculate total number amount of hours etc for week or month only number of days or per day That is gaping deficit in these app with the exception of one or two with less desirable formats as it is far better way to track things like sleep which may fluctuate from day to day The other dismaying factor is that Habitbull doesn seem to have any customer service as mailed numerous times about issues trying to upgrade because it is really helpful useful application and never got any response in about year time Aside from the tabulation inadequacy discussed above which really hope they ll address include that capability it is really helpful and useful app and can be especially helpful for people with issues such as depression or OCD who may have difficulty keeping handle on self care and or productivity though it could also have the opposite effect if people with OCD get too immersed in tracking things in their day to day In general it is good tool to have though and can help you make lot of progress on things like household projects etc but really do wish that they adjust it so that you can calculate total for duration of time longer than day and that they would also be conscientious about customer service support and responding to fielding correspondence and issues people encounter Kristin Star

This is re review This could be the best habit tracker goal setter and task manager with some really great features like nested li and smart auto grouping and very versatile repeat task setup Just don confuse the game in RPG for any actual gameplay but it does have very elaborate character design and advancement tem that deserves recognition allowing for well rounded and unique hero which grows with every task performed in the user daily life However Do It Now does hamstring itself by overlooking some very important integral functionality Firstly there is no way to order the ta set out in any of the groups After solid month of use building some projects with subta which had subta and setting up several habit based routines the lack of prioritisation or task ordering created confusing clutter of items which looked no different from the next While auto grouping and smart grouping should have been able to help sort that out the lack of ability for the user to remove any task from these groups meant every task appeared once again losing the important ones in the clutter User defined groups could only contain the items specifically placed in them but once again large project with number of different aspects can not be ordered into sensible linear series With no social aspect currently attached to the app as at ver there is no task sharing There is also no designated pc mac linux front end for desktop syncing Finally it expensive as apps go one off of will get the full version or about month paid yearly which removes ads and gives calendar access Original review good way to make the tedium of self regulation bit more fun Being able to plan to skip things when away from regular activities is handy It would be nice to see characteristic and skill based modifiers affect related task improvements as they raise and subtask attached leader
